intro: Callicarpa chinyunensis, commonly known as the Yunnan beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered, violet-blue berries that ripen in the fall. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and white, appearing in clusters. The berries are not only ornamental but also serve as a food source for various birds and small mammals.
